segment.source: 4902(S) The Per-user audit policy table was created.
segment.target: 4902(S) The Per-user audit policy table was created.

segment.source: (Windows 10)
segment.target: (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes security event 4902(S) The Per-user audit policy table was created.
segment.target: Describes security event 4902(S) The Per-user audit policy table was created.

segment.source: 4902(S): The Per-user audit policy table was created.
segment.target: 4902(S): The Per-user audit policy table was created.

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Event Description:
segment.target: Event Description:

segment.source: This event generates during system startup if Per-user audit policy is defined on the computer.
segment.target: This event generates during system startup if Per-user audit policy is defined on the computer.

segment.source: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.
segment.target: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.

segment.source: Event XML:
segment.target: Event XML:

segment.source: Required Server Roles: None.
segment.target: Required Server Roles: None.

segment.source: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.
segment.target: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.

segment.source: Event Versions: 0.
segment.target: Event Versions: 0.

segment.source: Field Descriptions:
segment.target: Field Descriptions:

segment.source: Number of Elements Type = UInt32: number of users for which Per-user policies were defined (number of unique users).
segment.target: Number of Elements Type = UInt32: number of users for which Per-user policies were defined (number of unique users).

segment.source: You can get the list of users for which Per-user policies are defined using “auditpol /list /user” command:
segment.target: You can get the list of users for which Per-user policies are defined using “auditpol /list /user” command:

segment.source: Policy ID Type = HexInt64: unique per-User Audit Policy hexadecimal identifier.
segment.target: Policy ID Type = HexInt64: unique per-User Audit Policy hexadecimal identifier.

segment.source: Security Monitoring Recommendations
segment.target: Security Monitoring Recommendations

segment.source: For 4902(S): The Per-user audit policy table was created.
segment.target: For 4902(S): The Per-user audit policy table was created.

segment.source: If you don’t expect to see any per-User Audit Policies enabled on specific computers (Computer), monitor for these events.
segment.target: If you don’t expect to see any per-User Audit Policies enabled on specific computers (Computer), monitor for these events.

segment.source: If you don’t use per-User Audit Policies in your network, monitor for these events.
segment.target: If you don’t use per-User Audit Policies in your network, monitor for these events.

segment.source: Typically this is an informational event and has little to no security relevance.
segment.target: Typically this is an informational event and has little to no security relevance.
